com.gratex.perconik.activity.ide.listeners

Class IdeListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core.AbstractRegistrable
      • sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core.Adapter
        • com.gratex.perconik.activity.ide.listeners.IdeListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener, Registrable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IdeCodeListener, IdeCommitListener, IdeDocumentListener, IdeElementListener, IdeFindListener, IdeProjectListener, IdeStateListener

    public abstract class IdeListener
extends Adapter
    A base class for all IDE listeners. This listener documents what data is available in base abstract types of data transfer objects. These abstract types, in type hierarchy order, are:
    • EventDto - root of all events.
    • IdeEventDto - root of all IDE events.
    • IdeSlnPrjEventDto - root of all IDE events with known event related project and workspace.

    Data available in an EventDto:

    • isMilestone - activity milestone flag, set to true if the event is an instance of:
      • IdeCheckinDto,
      • IdeCodeOperationDto,
      • IdeDocumentOperationDto and document operation type is ADD, REMOVE or SAVE,
      • IdeProjectOperationDto,
      • IdeStateChangeDto.
    • time - time when the event occurred with time zone and precision set to hundredth seconds.

    Data available in an IdeEventDto:

    • applicationName - IDE application name, for example Eclipse Platform.
    • applicationVersion - IDE application version, for example 4.3.1.v20130911-1000.
    • idePid - IDE application process identifier or -1 if it can not be determined.

    Data available in an IdeSlnPrjEventDto:

    • projectName - related project name. In case when the project name can not be determined, such as when not editable source code is selected, the project name is set to the accompanying library, mostly some JAR file, for example "rt.jar" for standard JRE system library. Note that the workspace name always is preserved.
    • solutionName - related workspace name (workspace of the related project). The workspace name is the workspace root directory name.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pavol Zbell
